intro: Pleurospermum forrestii, commonly known as the Chinese angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, oval fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is typically found in rocky or mountainous regions and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
